DOC.brief_summary: Caffeinol combination caffeine alcohol . The amount give 1-2 glass wine 3-4 cup coffee . The patient receive one time dose give two hour cool 34.5 C .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Age 1880 year 2 . Clinical presentation acute ischemic stroke 3 . Computed tomography ( CT ) scan compatible acute ischemic stroke . 4 . Time caffeinol treatment < 240 minute stroke onset . 5 . Time hypothermia initiation < 300 minute stroke onset . 6 . Presumed cortical location stroke ( must least sign aphasia , neglect , visual field cut ) 7 . National Institutes Health Stroke Scale ( NIHSS ) > 8 time treatment . 8 . Tissue plasminogen activator ( TPA ) treat patient must meet established criterion TPA . 1 . Etiology ischemic stroke . 2 . Item 1a NIHSS > 1 3 . Signs/symptoms subcortical , brainstem cerebellar stroke . 4 . Symptoms resolve NIHSS < 8 time treatment . 5 . NIHSS > 20 right hemisphere > 25 leave hemisphere 6 . Known alcoholic 7 . Clinical laboratory evidence alcohol intoxication . 8 . Historical evidence exogenous caffeine exposure beyond daily consumption coffee soft drink . 9 . Known hematologic dyscrasia affect thrombosis . 10 . Comorbid condition likely complicate therapy : 1 . Endstage cardiomyopathy 2 . Uncompensated clinically significant arrhythmia 3 . Myopathy 4 . Liver disease 5 . History pelvic abdominal mass likely compress inferior vena cava . 6 . Endstage AIDS 7 . History clinically significant gastrointestinal ( GI ) bleed 8 . Impaired renal function creatinine clearance , 50 ml/min 11 . Intracerebral / intraventricular hemorrhage 12 . Systolic blood pressure ( SBP ) > 210 < 100 ; diastolic blood pressure ( DBP ) > 100 < 50 mmHg 13 . Severe coagulopathy 14 . Pregnancy 15 . Use monoamine oxidase inhibitor ( MAOI ) , serotoninspecific reuptake inhibitor ( SSRI ) Tricyclic Antidepressants ( TCA ) within precede 2 week 16 . Known history epilepsy .
